hint.text: Look at the expressions and make a list of number of variables and constants. Then count the number of distinct variables.

solution.text:
\(_{j}_x\). Correct. The only variable is x
\(_{j}_x+_{k}_\). Correct. The only variable is x
\(_{j}_y + x\). Incorrect. There are two variables here: x and y
\(_{j}_t\). Correct. The only variable is t
\(_{j}_xy\). Incorrect. There are two variables here: x and y
\(_{j}_z\). Correct. The only variable is z
\(_{j}_p^2 + 5\). Correct. The only variable is p
\(_{j}_q^3\). Correct. The only variable is q

content.text: Which of the following expressions have only one variable?
